Series.Overview: Hana's Helpline is a stop-motion animation series for children, about Hana the duck agony aunt who runs a telephone helpline for animals with problems.

Episode.Overview: Ellen may be a bird unable to take flight, but Hana the duck helps her to realise that she can move very quickly while still on the ground.
Helpful Hana the duck has to contend with Bert the bear's fear of the dark. Before long, she arranges him to meet an insomniac firefly by the name of Fergus.
Panda Rosie despairs that she doesn't shine at anything, until Hana the helpful duck points out that she's an integral part of a team.
Douglas the duckling is afraid of learning to swim until Hana provides reassurance.
Hana the problem-solving duck offers a helping hand to Gazza the gorilla, who is scared of the outside world.
Hana the duck heeds a cry for help from another animal friend. Cyril is unable to remember the whereabouts of his belongings, but Hana's special song may help.
Myrtle the turtle is shy and cannot make friends. Hana and the team help Myrtle come out of her shell.
Olivia is a little octopus who feels really clumsy until Hana helps her discover that with her hands she can do six things all at once.
Patsy is a little pig with a personal freshness problem. Hana helps her discover that bathing makes you more popular.
Ffion the frog always tells fibs to impress her friends. Hana helps her to be happy just being herself.
Lee the lion cub is afraid of going to the dentist... Hana to the rescue!
Muzzy the mouse is scared of thunderstorms but Hana helps him to control his fear by drawing.
Poor Ellen the ostrich is always getting lost. However, she is soon helped by Hana the duck, who teaches her the difference between left and right.
The duck agony aunt meets Patsy the piglet, who wants to swap her baby brother for something better. Hana persuades her that it's fun to have someone to look after.
How can Gwenda the giraffe excel at a game of hide and seek when she's so tall? Fortunately, Hana the duck is at hand to point out why her height can be a bonus.
Olivia the octopus is not very good at sport, so Hana helps her become a ballerina.
Muzzy the mouse is tired of being mocked for his diminutive stature, but Hana the duck shows him how his size can come in useful in a go-kart race.
Ernie the eagle's incessant drumming is annoying his peers, but Hana the helpful duck is quick to spot his musical talent.
Douglas the duck is the victim of bullying, but helpful Hana tells him not to suffer in silence and share his problem with his friends.
Mrs Winger is organising the school's nativity play, but is there really no room for Fergus the firefly in the cast? Hana the duck, however, may be able to help out.
Patsy Pig has mislaid her favourite teddy bear, but perhaps the search that Hana the duck has organised will find him.
Ffion the frog is affronted by the arrival of a skunk foster sister. Will Hana the helpful duck have a way to stop her sulking?
Having a fear of heights is impractical for Cyril the squirrel, but perhaps Hana the agony aunt duck has a way of conquering his phobia.
Hana the duck offers a helping hand to another of her animal friends as she teaches Bert the bear to look after the belongings of others.
Francis the duckling is finding it hard to master riding a bike, but his mum - Hana the helpful duck - may have the answer.
Calling Hana today is Lee the lion cub, who is having trouble finding his mum a suitable gift for Mother's Day.
Douglas the duckling is so busy looking after his sick mum that he's always late for school. Hana helps him to realise that it's OK to ask for help.
Patsy makes herself unpopular by being a messy little pig who never tidies anything away. Can Hana help her change her ways?
Lee the lion cub keeps waking up in odd places until Hana discovers that he sleepwalks!
Greta the gorilla falls behind at school because she can't hear properly. Luckily, Hana is a very good listener.
Myrtle the turtle has problems in counting up to ten, but due to Hana's help, she will be able to assist Owen in putting up shelves.
Muzzy Mouse is upset when his grandad dies, so Hana helps him build a special garden to remember him by.
Ernie the eagle can't stand losing at anything! Can Hana help him learn to lose with grace?
Lee is a big lion with an even bigger problem: he's terrified of creepy crawlies! Can Hana help him overcome his fear of beasties?
Hana helps out Sian, a skunk who has been having problems fitting in with life at her new school.
The helpful duck agony aunt tries to assist a little hedgehog who never stays in one place long enough to make friends.
Gwenda the giraffe is unwilling to share her best friend Ffion with anyone else. Can Hana find a solution?
Katy the kitten wants to make music, but unfortunately she is a terrible singer!
Hana helps out when poor Muzzy the mouse keeps having little accidents. Hana customises a special toilet for Muzzy to use.
A little penguin called Hywel misses his home, where he could sledge any time he liked.
Hana arranges for Rita Cheetah to coach Rhian, a little rabbit with a disability who wants nothing more than to compete on Sports Day.
Katy the kitten despairs that she has no special talent, until Hana the duck helps her to realise her passion for horticulture.
Jasper the parrot is acting the 'class clown', but behind the wisecracking, he is moulting.
Hana the agony aunt duck offers a helping hand to Bert who, after a sporting injury, expresses concern about playing basketball again.
When Percy the peacock antagonises everyone with his critical remarks, Hana the agony aunt duck waddles in to offer assistance.
Hana the duck lends a helping hand today to Bert the bear, who suffers from travel sickness.
Hana the duck discovers that Ernie feels inferior to his seemingly perfect cousin, Jeremy. What advice will she offer?
Hana offers a helping hand of advice to Douglas the duckling, who insists that it's only possible to have fun by spending money.
Rosie the panda has nerves when she is selected to present a bouquet to a very important figure. What advice will Hana give her?
The agony aunt duck offers a helping hand to Penri the puffin, who misses his comfort blanket when he goes to school.
Today, when Francis's grandmother pays him a visit, chaos ensues.
Lee the lion is very inquisitive and asks lots of questions, but nobody knows the answers. Hana shows him a place where he can find out all he needs to know.
